io.polestar.api

Interface IPolestarQuery


  • public interface IPolestarQuery
    A sensor query to perform a historical query on sensor state

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • setStart

        IPolestarQuery setStart(long aStartTime)
        Set start time for period in which query is processed in milliseconds from datum (i.e. System.currentTimeMillis() ). Negative values offset from current time. Default start time is exactly one day before current time.
        Parameters:
        aStartTime - start time

      • setEnd

        IPolestarQuery setEnd(long aEndTime)
        Set end time for period in which query is processed in milliseconds from datum (i.e. System.currentTimeMillis() ). Negative values offset from current time. Default end time is current time.
        Parameters:
        aEndTime - end time

      • setQueryParameter

        IPolestarQuery setQueryParameter(java.lang.Object aParameter)
                                 throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Set a parameter for a specific query
        Parameters:
        aParameter - value for specific query type.
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • setResultSetPeriod

        IPolestarQuery setResultSetPeriod(long aPeriod)
                                  throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Set a period in milliseconds to sub-divide time between query start and end and return back multiple results. If not specified then whole period is sampled and a single result returned. Queries that return time will return time offset from start of period when setResultSetPeriod is used.
        Parameters:
        aPeriod - period in milliseconds
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException - if period cannot be set on this type of query

      • setQueryMatcher

        IPolestarQuery setQueryMatcher(IPolestarMatcher aMatcher)
                               throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Set a matcher for a specific query
        Parameters:
        aMatcher - matcher for specific query type.
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • setTimeMerge

        IPolestarQuery setTimeMerge(int aPeriodCount)
                            throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Execute query over a series of start-to-end periods and merge results. Merge operation defaults to AVERAGE but can be specified with setTimeMergeOp()
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • setTimeMergeOp

        IPolestarQuery setTimeMergeOp(QueryType aOp)
                              throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Specifies how multiple resultsets are merged Merge operation defaults to AVERAGE but can be specified with setTimeMergeOp()
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • setTimeMergeParameter

        IPolestarQuery setTimeMergeParameter(java.lang.Object aParameter)
                                     throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Set a parameter for a specific query
        Parameters:
        aParameter - value for specific query type.
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • setTimeMergePeriod

        IPolestarQuery setTimeMergePeriod(long aPeriod)
                                  throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Set a period in milliseconds to separate merge periods. By default merge periods are consecutive, so TimeMergePeriod is equal to (End-Start)
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException

      • execute

        java.lang.Object execute()
                         throws org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException
        Execute the query
        Returns:
        value, timestamp, duration, or IPolestarQueryResultSet from query
        Throws:
        org.netkernel.layer0.nkf.NKFException - if query fails
